Description: Fine, heavy and solid ivory dice. Well balanced with pips cut in correct order; 1:6, 2:5, 3:4. Chip off one corner.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Numerous solid six-sided (cubic) dice, predominantly of limestone with drilled pips (but also of faience, ivory, marble, pumice and terracotta) were found at Naukratis. Parallels known from the 7th century BC, but are particularly popular in the Roman period (Cool 2016, 229-231). Cool, H. E. M. 2016. The small finds and vessel glass from Insula VI.1 Pompeii: Excavations 1995-2006. Oxford: Archaeopress, Roman Archaeology 17.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TH.03)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens (committee)
